# The `formatted_raw_ostream` Class Reference

<DoxygenPage pluginConfig={pluginConfig}>

<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/formatted-raw-ostream">formatted&#95;raw&#95;ostream</a> - A <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/raw-ostream">raw&#95;ostream</a> that wraps another one and keeps track of line and column position, allowing padding out to specific column boundaries and querying the number of lines written to the stream. <a href="#details">More...</a>

## Description {#details}

<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/formatted-raw-ostream">formatted&#95;raw&#95;ostream</a> - A <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/raw-ostream">raw&#95;ostream</a> that wraps another one and keeps track of line and column position, allowing padding out to specific column boundaries and querying the number of lines written to the stream.

This assumes that the contents of the stream is valid UTF-8 encoded text. This doesn&#39;t attempt to handle everything Unicode can do (combining characters, right-to-left markers, etc), but should cover the cases likely to appear in source code or diagnostic messages.

Definition at line 30 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/formattedstream-h">FormattedStream.h</a>.

<SectionDefinition>

## Public Constructors

### formatted&#95;raw&#95;ostream() {#adb8a7ef601b3598707e6ae9a6c9f6e4d}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>llvm::formatted&#95;raw&#95;ostream::formatted&#95;raw&#95;ostream (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/raw-ostream">raw&#95;ostream</a> &amp; Stream)</>}
  labels = {["inline"]}>
<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/formatted-raw-ostream">formatted&#95;raw&#95;ostream</a> - Open the specified file for writing.

If an error occurs, information about the error is put into <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/errorinfo">ErrorInfo</a>, and the stream should be immediately destroyed; the string will be empty if no error occurred.

As a side effect, the given Stream is set to be Unbuffered. This is because <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/formatted-raw-ostream">formatted&#95;raw&#95;ostream</a> does its own buffering, so it doesn&#39;t want another layer of buffering to be happening underneath it.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/formattedstream-h/#l00134">134</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/formattedstream-h">FormattedStream.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

PadToColumn - <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/align">Align</a> the output to some column number.

If the current column is already equal to or more than NewCol, PadToColumn inserts one space.

### ComputePosition() {#a2497e9ad2f28aab73f9015b9d1d30172}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void formatted&#95;raw&#95;ostream::ComputePosition (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> char &#42; Ptr, size&#95;t size)</>}>
ComputePosition - Examine the given output buffer and figure out the new position after output.

ComputePosition - Examine the current output and update line and column counts.

This is safe to call multiple times on the same buffer, as it records the most recently scanned character and resumes from there when the buffer has not been flushed.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/formattedstream-h/#l00074">74</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/formattedstream-h">FormattedStream.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/formattedstream-cpp/#l00103">103</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/formattedstream-cpp">FormattedStream.cpp</a>.

### UpdatePosition() {#aaf580e50faf88ebc55f95743e66d8a5a}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void formatted&#95;raw&#95;ostream::UpdatePosition (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> char &#42; Ptr, size&#95;t Size)</>}>
UpdatePosition - scan the characters in &#91;Ptr, Ptr+Size), and update the line and column numbers.

UpdatePosition - Examine the given char sequence and figure out which column we end up in after output, and how many line breaks are contained.

Unlike ComputePosition, this must be called exactly once on each region of the buffer.

This assumes that the input string is well-formed UTF-8, and takes into account Unicode characters which render as multiple columns wide.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/formattedstream-h/#l00079">79</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/formattedstream-h">FormattedStream.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/formattedstream-cpp/#l00026">26</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/formattedstream-cpp">FormattedStream.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### write&#95;impl() {#abe0dc170ee1ac6595ff41750af4437fc}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void formatted&#95;raw&#95;ostream::write&#95;impl (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> char &#42; Ptr, size&#95;t Size)</>}
  labels = {["virtual"]}>
The is the piece of the class that is implemented by subclasses.

This writes the <code>Size</code> bytes starting at <code>Ptr</code> to the underlying stream.

This function is guaranteed to only be called at a point at which it is safe for the subclass to install a new buffer via SetBuffer.


<ParametersList title="Parameters">
<ParametersListItem name="Ptr">The start of the data to be written. For buffered streams this is guaranteed to be the start of the buffer.</ParametersListItem>
<ParametersListItem name="Size">The number of bytes to be written.</ParametersListItem>
</ParametersList>

<SectionUser title="Invariant">
&#123; Size &gt; 0 &#125;
</SectionUser>

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/formattedstream-h/#l00059">59</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/formattedstream-h">FormattedStream.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/formattedstream-cpp/#l00134">134</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/formattedstream-cpp">FormattedStream.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

</SectionDefinition>

</MemberDefinition>

### PartialUTF8Char {#a490061834f20e68204c00bd9bc577e14}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>SmallString&lt;4&gt; llvm::formatted&#95;raw&#95;ostream::PartialUTF8Char</>}>
PartialUTF8Char - Either empty or a prefix of a UTF-8 code unit sequence for a Unicode scalar value which should be prepended to the buffer for the next call to ComputePosition.

This is needed when the buffer is flushed when it ends part-way through the UTF-8 encoding of a Unicode scalar value, so that we can compute the display width of the character once we have the rest of it.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/formattedstream-h/#l00053">53</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/formattedstream-h">FormattedStream.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### Position {#a7d20fff48491cf6e6182fa6a4413dc6e}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>std::pair&lt;unsigned, unsigned&gt; llvm::formatted&#95;raw&#95;ostream::Position</>}>
Position - The current output column and line of the data that&#39;s been flushed and the portion of the buffer that&#39;s been scanned.

The line and column scheme is zero-based.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/formattedstream-h/#l00040">40</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/formattedstream-h">FormattedStream.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

<MemberDefinition

Scanned - This points to one past the last character in the buffer we&#39;ve scanned.

### TheStream {#a56328b4f76c62594d9aab1a7c150e858}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>raw&#95;ostream&#42; llvm::formatted&#95;raw&#95;ostream::TheStream</>}>
TheStream - The real stream we output to.

We set it to be unbuffered, since we&#39;re already doing our own buffering.
